error_description: SQL injection vulnerability due to direct string concatenation of username in native SQL query
Missing addressRepository.save(addressEntity) call in save method; newly created address is never persisted to the database

Double password encoding in updateUserEntityFromUserRequest mapping: passwordEncoder.encode(passwordEncoder.encode(dto.password())) incorrectly hashes an already hashed password, breaking password updates
Missing @PreAuthorize annotation on delete method allows any authenticated user to delete any user account, violating access control
Missing @Validated(Update.class) on update method's @RequestBody AddressRequest parameter skips Update group validations like @Pattern for non-empty fields
Missing @Validated(Create.class) or @Valid on create method's @RequestBody UserRequest parameter bypasses all input validation constraints
@PostMapping(consumes = "text/plain") incompatible with JSON deserialization of AddressRequest record; use application/json or omit consumes
listAll loads all users with findAll() ignoring Pageable, creates PageImpl with full list causing incorrect pagination metadata and high memory usage
checkLogin uses .get() on Optional<User> causing NoSuchElementException if user not found, preventing secure dummy hash comparison for timing attack protection
Missing userRepository.delete(existingUserEntity) or deleteById(id) in delete method; user account is found but never deleted
getById inconsistently uses .get() on Optional<Address> instead of orElseThrow with ResourceNotFoundException like other methods
